pullRequest.title: Set log level run time
pullRequest.bodyText:
This story provides the following -

a user is able to provide the settings
settings can be changed on the fly
The server can adjust the log level according to the settings

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) 2020 Broadcom. + * The term "Broadcom" refers to Broadcom Inc. and/or its subsidiaries. + * + * This program and the accompanying materials are made + * available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 + * which is available at https://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0/ + * + * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 + * + * Contributors: + * Broadcom, Inc. - initial API and implementation + * + */ +package com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.core.messages; + +import com.google.common.collect.Iterables; +import com.google.gson.JsonPrimitive; +import lombok.experimental.UtilityClass; +import org.slf4j.Logger; +import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory; + +import java.util.List; +import java.util.Objects; +import java.util.function.Consumer; + +/** + * Update the log level for the application. + * + *

IMPORTANT: This class relies on the concrete implementations by logback. SLF4J don't expose + * any contract to update the log level on runtime. + * + *

In case of wrong input, log level defaults to {@link ch.qos.logback.classic.Level#ERROR} + */ +@UtilityClass +public class LogLevel {

nodes.bodyText: Below you provide: logLevelNode.getAsString() which returns String, then why you need to check for "instanceof JsonPrimitive"

nodes.bodyText: Locale settings should be hidden until we really support multiple locales. Please, remove this one
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -108,6 +108,32 @@
                     },
                     "description": "Default list of datasets to search for copybooks",
                     "uniqueItems": true
+                },
+                "broadcom-cobol-lsp.logging.level.root": {
+                    "type": "string",
+                    "default": "ERROR",
+                    "enum": [
+                        "ERROR",
+                        "DEBUG",
+                        "INFO",
+                        "WARN",
+                        "TRACE",
+                        "ALL"
+                    ],
+                    "enumDescriptions": [
+                        "ERROR level logs error events which may or not be fatal to the application",
+                        "DEBUG level logs informational events of very low importance",
+                        "INFO level logs informational messages highlighting overall progress of the application",
+                        "WARN level logs potentially harmful situations",
+                        "TRACE level logs informational events of very low importance",
+                        "ALL level is used to turn on all logging"
+                    ],
+                    "description": "log level for COBOL LSP server."
+                },
+                "broadcom-cobol-lsp.locale": {
+                    "type": "string",
+                    "default": "en",
+                    "description": "locale for the COBOL LSP server."

nodes.bodyText: The top-down order should be ERROR-WARN-INFO-DEBUG-TRACE-ALL

commit.message:
remove locale config, until multiple locale is supported.

Signed-off-by: ap891843 <aman.prashant@broadcom.com>

Update clients/cobol-lsp-vscode-extension/package.json

Co-authored-by: Andrei Temnikov <andrei.temnikov@broadcom.com>

top-down order for logging level as suggested in code review.

Signed-off-by: ap891843 <aman.prashant@broadcom.com>

remove locale config, until multiple locale is supported.
